elements.description:
`furo-api-fetch`

furo-api-fetch can be used for network requests via FETCH API

```html
<furo-api-fetch ƒ-invoke-request="" ƒ-abort-request=""></furo-api-fetch>
```

properties.name: lastRequest
properties.description:
LastRequest's response.

Note that lastResponse is set when ongoing request finishes, so if loading is true,
then lastResponse will correspond to the result of the previous request.

methods.name: invokeRequest
methods.description: Sends a HTTP request to the server

params.name: request
params.description: (The Request interface of the Fetch API represents a resource request.) https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request

methods.name: abortRequest
methods.description:
Aborts a pending request
You have to submit an AbortController

params.name: controller
params.description:
(The AbortController interface represents a controller object that allows you to abort one or more DOM requests as and when desired.)
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AbortController

methods.name: _executeRequest
methods.description:
Requests are made via the Fetch API if possible.
Fallback XMLHttpRequest

**payload** request object

methods.name: _reworkRequest
methods.description:
Errorhandling according to Google rest-api-v3 Status Codes
(https://developers.google.com/maps-booking/reference/rest-api-v3/status_codes)

Dispatches event `response-error` and a specific error event with status code

methods.name: _parseResponse
methods.description: eslint-disable-next-line class-methods-use-this

elements.name: FuroApiFetch

events.name: fatal-error
events.description:
Requests are made via the Fetch API if possible.
Fallback XMLHttpRequest

*payload** request object

events.name: request-aborted
events.description:
Fired when a request was canceled.
Payload: request

events.name: request-started
events.description:
Fired when a request is sent.
Payload: request

events.name: response
events.description:
Fired when a response is received.
Here you will get the parsed response
Format depends on request header `content-type`
supported types:
- text/plain
- application/json
- image/jpeg (Blob)
- application/octet-stream (ArrayBuffer)
- application/pdf (Blob)

Payload: parsed response

events.name: response-error
events.description:
Fired when an error has occoured.
This is a general error event. The specific error events are fired additionally.

events.name: response-error-[status-code]
events.description:
Fired when an error has occoured.
This is a specific error event.

events.name: response-raw
events.description:
Fired when a response is received.
Here you will get the raw response object
Payload: Raw response

elements.description:
`furo-collection-agent` is an interface component to handle collection requests. It helps you with paginating collection data.




How to use:
```html
   <furo-collection-agent
                     service="Servicename"
                     ƒ-hts-in="--hts"
                     list-on-hts-in
                   ></furo-collection-agent>
```
elements.summary: interface component to handle collection requests

properties.name: filter
properties.description:
Set the filter.

Hint: use the FieldNode._base64 property to send complex objects as a filter and decode it on the server side.

Only useable if your service has implemented this feature.

properties.name: service
properties.description: The service name from the specs.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description:
Sets pagination size in the List request.

Only useful if your service supports pagination.

properties.name: fields
properties.description:
Comma separated list of fields (like a fieldmask)
used for partial representation / partial responses.

If your services supports this feature, you will receive a subset of the fields.

properties.name: orderBy
properties.description:
Sorting order

order-by="foo,-bar"  means foo asc and bar desc

https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/design_patterns#sorting_order

To avoid sql injection errors we do not send any sql like syntax!

Only useable if your service has implemented this feature.

properties.name: view
properties.description:
Parameter for contextual representations

To reduce network traffic, it is sometimes useful to allow the client to limit which parts of the resource the server should return in its responses,
returning a view of the resource (i.e. specialized version for dropdowns ) instead of the full resource representation.

https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/design_patterns#resource_view

view=smallcards

Only useable if your service has implemented this feature.

properties.name: listOnHtsIn
properties.description: Executes a list when a rel="list" is injected.

properties.name: loadRelOnHtsIn
properties.description:
Executes a loadRel when a rel="XXXX" is injected.

You have to set the attributes *rel* and *method* to have this working.

This is useful for getting "custom" collections.

properties.name: rel
properties.description: rel which should be used on load rel

properties.name: method
properties.description:
for compatibility reasons you have to specify the method inside of the service.

This attribute should not be needed in future versions, because the rel already contains all relevant information.

methods.name: _attachListeners
methods.description: Attaches temporary listeners to fire load-success, load-fail, delete-success,...

methods.name: setFields
methods.description:
Comma separated list of fields (like a fieldmask)
used for partial representation / partial responses.

If your services supports this feature, you will receive a subset of the fields.

methods.name: setOrderBy
methods.description:
Sorting order

order-by="foo,-bar"  means foo asc and bar desc

https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/design_patterns#sorting_order

To avoid sql injection errors we do not send any sql like syntax!

Only useable if your service has implemented this feature.

methods.name: clearFilter
methods.description: clear the setted filter

methods.name: setFilter
methods.description:
Set the filter.

Hint: use the FieldNode._base64 property to send complex objects as a filter and decode it on the server side.

Only useable if your service has implemented this feature.

methods.name: setPageSize
methods.description:
Sets pagination size in the List request.

Only useful if your service supports pagination.

methods.name: updateQp
methods.description:
Update query params
a qp like {"active":true} will just update the qp *active*

If the current value of the qp is not the same like the injected value, a qp-changed event will be fired

methods.name: setQp
methods.description:
Set query params
All existing query params are replaced by the transferred parameters
If the transferred object is empty, all the values will be removed!
The AgentHelper fires a qp-set event after the query params are replaced.

methods.name: clearQp
methods.description: clear the query params that you have setted before

methods.name: _followRelService
methods.description:
If HATEOAS is present, the wire --triggerLoad is fired with the
corresponding request object as payload.

methods.name: list
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: load
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: loadRel
methods.description: loads the entity following the link which is specified on the attribute **rel** if it is available.

methods.name: searchRel
methods.description:
search for a term following the link which is specified on the attribute **rel**

This will set the query param q and execute the query.

methods.name: search
methods.description:
search for a term.

This will set the query param q and triggers a list()

methods.name: first
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: prev
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: next
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: last
methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.name: htsIn
methods.description: Inject HATEOAS links.

elements.description:
`furo-data-object` gives you a object which is built based on the **type** spec.
The types must be available in the {Env}, learn more about setting up the environment in the guide.

The data will mostly be used in a [data-ui]/(../../data-input/doc) component or in component that yoh build, which contains one or more of them.

`furo-data-object` receives its data regularly from a [collection-aget](furo-collection-agent) or a  [entity-aget](furo-entity-agent).
But you can also send json data which is formed like the raw-data of this type.

`furo-data-object` will not do any validation or data manipulation neither will send the data. It is just responsible to
transform incomming data to an object and vice versa. You can access the manipulated data structure on the property
`.data.rawData` with javascript (if needed).

```html
 <!-- The furo-data-object will send a initial dataObject of type project.Project on @-response-ready -->
 <furo-data-object type="project.Project" ƒ-inject-raw="--response(*.data)" @-object-ready="--dataObject"></furo-data-object>

 <!-- The furo-entity-agent will fetch the data from ProjectService and pass it in @-response to the furo-data-object.  -->
 <furo-entity-agent service="ProjectService" ƒ-save="--saveClicked" ƒ-bind-request-data="--dataObject" @-response="--response" ></furo-entity-agent>
```

properties.name: type
properties.description: The name of the type you want to use. The type must be registered in Env

properties.name: json
properties.description: get the data from the data object as raw json

methods.name: injectRaw
methods.description:
inject a raw data response from the corresonding agent.

Input may look something like this:

**Entity data**
```json
 {data:{},links:[],meta{}}
```

**Collection data**
```json
 {data:{},links:[],meta{},entities:[]}
```

methods.name: clearAllErrors
methods.description: Clears all errors on children without any validation!

methods.name: validateAllFields
methods.description:
Triggers the validation of all fields in the data object.

Use this before you submit some data to a server.

Will cause a `data-object-became-valid` or `data-object-became-invalid` and a validation-success or validation-failed event.

methods.name: reset
methods.description:
Reset the model to the last injected state.

To set the model to the initial state use init

methods.name: init
getData
methods.description: get the data of the data object

elements.name: FuroDataObject

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The name of the type you want to use. The type must be registered in Env

data-changed
Fired when data in furo-data-object has changed

This event fires a lot, consider using a de-bounce with the event.

*detail payload:** {Object|CollectionNode}

*bubbles**

events.name: data-changed-after-inject
events.description:
data-changed-after-inject
Fired when data in furo-data-object has changed after injectRaw is complete

This event fires a lot, consider using a de-bounce with the event.

*detail payload:** {Object|CollectionNode}

*bubbles**

Fired when injected data was processed.

*detail payload**: {Object|EntityNode} reference to entity

*bubbles**

Fired when the data object switches from ininvalid to invalid state

*detail payload**: {Object|EntityNode} reference to entity

*bubbles**

events.name: data-object-became-valid
events.description:
data-object-became-valid
Fired when the data object switches from invalid to valid state

*detail payload**: {Object|EntityNode} reference to entity

*bubbles**

field-value-changed
Fired when a field has changed

object-ready
Fired when the object is built (based on the type).

*detail payload:** A EntityNode object

*bubbles**

validation-failed
Fired when validation results in a invalid state

events.name: validation-success

elements.description:
`furo-deep-link`
Resolve deep links HATEOAS based on the query params and the selected service.

*Deeplink inside of a furo-page*
```html
<furo-deep-link service="TaskService" ƒ-qp-in="--pageQueryChanged(*.query)" @-hts-out="--serviceHTS"></furo-deep-link>
```

Services must be registered in the Env:

```html
import {Services,Types} from "./apiConfig.js"
Init.registerApiServices(Services);
Init.registerApiTypes(Types);
```
Usually this is done in your src/configs/init.js
elements.summary: Resolve deep links HATEOAS based on  query params

properties.name: service
properties.description:
Set the service name like `TaskService`.

Services must be registered before.

methods.name: qpIn
methods.description:
Furo-deep-link consumes a object literal with key value pairs.

This can come from the `*.query` part of an event from furo-location.

Or from a furo-pages wire.

Relevant wires from furo-pages:
- --pageQueryChanged(*.query)
- --pageActivated(*.query)
- --pageHashChanged(*.query)

methods.name: trigger
methods.description:
Evaluates hts. Use qpIn(qp) if you have a qp object in your event.detail
This method have no effect as long _qp is not set.

methods.name: setService
methods.description: Sets the service by wire

elements.name: FuroDeepLink

attributes.name: service
attributes.description:
Set the service name like `TaskService`.

Services must be registered before.

events.name: hts-out
events.description:
hts-out
Fired when hateoas is available

```json
[
   {
       "rel": "list",
       "href": "/api/mockdata/tasks/list.json",
       "method": "GET",
       "service": "TaskService"
     },
   {
       "rel": "create",
       "href": "api.otherhost.com/mockdata/tasks",
       "method": "PUT",
       "service": "TaskService"
     }
   ]

```

detail payload: {[]Links} Array of hateoas links

elements.description:
`furo-entity-agent` is an interface component to handle entity requests. It analyzes the hateoas data.

If you want to send all data on PUT (without filtering readonly fields) set `Env.api.sendAllDataOnMethodPut = true;`

Creates the query param update mask according to the google api design guidelines.

Your update service must have a query param **update_mask** to use this feature.

https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/standard_methods#update

You may not need it if your server can handle PATCHes without a update_mask
https://grpc-ecosystem.github.io/grpc-gateway/docs/patch.html

elements.description:
DEPRECATED Placeholder component to describe nested filters

`furo-filter-or` is used with `furo-filter-container`, `furo-filter-and` and `furo-filter-and` to build the filter string.
 With `furo-filter-or` you will set the bracket around the items inside.


```html
<!-- this will result in a filter like ((description OR start) AND (end OR cost_limit))
<furo-filter-container>
 <furo-filter-and>
   <`furo-filter-or`>
     <furo-filter-field field="description" is="in" ƒ-set-value="--defaultChanged"></furo-filter-field>
     <furo-filter-field field="start" is="gte" ƒ-set-value="--startChanged"></furo-filter-field>
   </furo-filter-or>
   <furo-filter-or>
     <furo-filter-field field="end" is="lte" ƒ-set-value="--endChanged"></furo-filter-field>
     <furo-filter-field field="cost_limit" is="eq" ƒ-set-value="--costlimitChanged"></furo-filter-field>
   </furo-filter-or>
 </furo-filter-and>
</furo-filter-container>
```
elements.summary: Placeholder component to describe nested filters
elements.name: FuroFilterContainer

filter-changed

detail payload: filter

filter-cleared

detail payload: none

elements.description:
DEPRECATED `furo-filter-field` is used with `furo-filter-container`, `furo-filter-and` and `furo-filter-and` to build the filter string.
 With `furo-filter-field` you will set the field, operator and value of a filter item.


```html
<!-- this will result in a filter like ((description OR start) AND (end OR cost_limit))
<furo-filter-container>
 <furo-filter-and>
   <`furo-filter-or`>
     <furo-filter-field field="description" is="in" ƒ-set-value="--defaultChanged"></furo-filter-field>
     <furo-filter-field field="start" is="gte" ƒ-set-value="--startChanged"></furo-filter-field>
   </furo-filter-or>
   <furo-filter-or>
     <furo-filter-field field="end" is="lte" ƒ-set-value="--endChanged"></furo-filter-field>
     <furo-filter-field field="cost_limit" is="eq" ƒ-set-value="--costlimitChanged"></furo-filter-field>
   </furo-filter-or>
 </furo-filter-and>
</furo-filter-container>
```


 ## Fitler operators

| Operator          | Meaning                            |
|:----------------- |:---------------------------------- |
| lt  oder <        | lower than |
| lte oder <=       | lower than or equal |
| gt  oder >        | greater than |
| gte oder >=       | greater than or equal |
| eq  oder =        | equal |
|  **more operators**     ||
| in                | in |
| btw               | between |
| btwe              | between but including the values  |
| is null           | is null, true,false |
| sw                | starts with |
| ew                | ends with |
| con               | contains |
| **negations**     ||
| !eq               | not equal |
| !btw              | outside, not between |
| !null             | not null |
| !con              | does not contain |
| !sw               | does not starts with |
| !ew               | does not ends with |
| !in               | not in |

properties.name: is
properties.description: Defines the operator.

elements.description:
`furo-rel-exists`
Checks if a rel exists in a hateaos Link array

properties.name: rel
properties.description: Name of the rel

properties.name: type
properties.description: define the type if you want a specific check on the type also

methods.name: inject
methods.description:
Inject a HTS Link Array to receive a `rel-exist` or a `rel-dont-exist` event.

inject returns true for existing links and false for non existing links.

elements.name: FuroRelExists

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: Name of the rel

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: define the type if you want a specific check on the type also

events.name: furo-rel-exists
events.description:
furo-rel-exists
Fired when rel exists in linkArray
detail payload: {Object} Hateoas Link

events.name: rel-dont-exist
events.description:
rel-dont-exist
Fired when rel does not exists in linkArray
detail payload: void

elements.description:
Converts hateoas to queryParams, which is useful for routing with app-flow


```html
 <furo-reverse-deep-link
     service="TaskService"
     rel="self" @-converted="--queryParams"
     ƒ-convert="--rawEntityOrCollection, --linksArray, --linkObject"
 ></furo-reverse-deep-link>
```
elements.summary: create query param object from HATEOAS

properties.name: service
properties.description: Name of service

properties.name: rel
properties.description:
Optional rel to convert.

Not needed if you inject a link object.

If you insert an entity rel self is taken. If you insert a collection, rel list is used.

methods.name: convert
methods.description:
converts the href of a LinkObject

returns Error on undefined service

return.desc: Object with query params key value

elements.name: FuroReverseDeepLink

attributes.name: service
attributes.description: Name of service

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Optional rel to convert.

Not needed if you inject a link object.

If you insert an entity rel self is taken. If you insert a collection, rel list is used.

events.name: converted
events.description:
converted
Fired when input was converted
detail payload: {object} QueryParams

elements.description:
`furo-sortby-container`

The string value should follow SQL syntax: comma separated list of fields. For example: "foo,bar".
The default sorting order is ascending. To specify descending order for a field, a suffix " desc" should be
appended to the field name. For example: "foo desc,bar".
Redundant space characters in the syntax are insignificant. "foo,bar desc" and "  foo ,  bar  desc  " are equivalent.

methods.name: addAscendingField
methods.description: foo,bar

methods.name: addDescendingField
methods.description: foo,bar desc

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the sort_by query and fires sortby-condition-updated

methods.name: _mapSorterToQuery
methods.description: https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/design_patterns#sorting_order

elements.name: FuroSortbyContainer

events.name: sortby-condition-updated
events.description: Is fired if a new sort condition is set.

staticMethods.name: updateQp
staticMethods.description:
Update query params
a qp like {"active":true} will just update the qp *active*

If the current value of the qp is not the same like the injected value, a qp-changed event will be fired

staticMethods.name: setQp
staticMethods.description:
Set query params
All existing query params are replaced by the transferred parameters
If the transferred object is empty or undefined, all the values will be removed!

staticMethods.name: getParams
staticMethods.description: get existing params from href and append query params

staticMethods.name: generateReq
staticMethods.description: generate request url from original link and qp

properties.description:
Returns required fields with all children which are modified or
not readonly

classes.description:
## internal events
- *this-field-became-invalid*, when a field gets invalid
- *field-became-invalid* **bubbles**, when a field gets invalid
- *this-field-became-valid*, when a field gets valid
- *field-became-valid* **bubbles**, when a field gets valid
- *this-field-value-changed*, when the value of a field changed
- *field-value-changed* **bubbles**, when the value of a field changed
- *this-metas-changed*, when the metas of a field changed
- *metas-changed* **bubbles**, when the meta of a field changed
- *oneof-field-cleared*, when a field in a oneof group was cleared
- *oneof-field-changed*, when a field in a oneof group was changed
- *this-node-field-added*, when a sub field was added to a field
- *node-field-added* **bubbles**, when a sub field was added to a field
- *this-node-field-deleted*, when a sub field was added to a field
- *node-field-deleted* **bubbles**, when a sub field was added to a field


## internal broadcasted events
- *parent-readonly-meta-set*, when readonly was set on a parent field

properties.name: _value
properties.description: returns the raw value of the field node

properties.name: _base64
properties.description: returns the value of the data object as a base64 encoded string

properties.name: _transmitValue
properties.description:
Returns all not readonly fields values with deep dive
Mandatory fields (required is true) MUST always be transmitted
!readonly || required

properties.name: _deltaValue
properties.description:
Returns all modified fields values with deep dive (! _pristine)
modified || required

properties.name: _requiredValue
properties.description:
Returns required fields with all children which are modified or
not readonly
! readonly || req || modified

methods.name: createField
methods.description:
create a field in a FieldNode, this is useful when using map<string,something>
  set the value option to init with values

methods.name: _hasAncestorOfType
methods.description: infinite recursive element protection

methods.name: reinit
methods.description:
sets the field to the initial values from the spec
default values are applied

methods.name: reset
methods.description:
resets the field to empty values
no default values are applied

methods.name: _checkConstraints
methods.description: check the validity against spec and meta

methods.name: _triggerDeepNodeEvent
methods.description:
fires a NodeEvent recursively
starting point is caller

methods.name: deleteNode
methods.description: deletes the fieldnode

params.name: error
params.description: {"description":"error description / message"} => used in data-input-type for hints

classes.name: FieldNode

classes.description: EntityNode is usually the root node of an eventTree

properties.name: _value
properties.description: Returns a json representation of your Data Object

properties.name: _base64
properties.description: returns the value of the data object as a base64 encoded string

methods.name: clearAllErrors
methods.description: clears all errors on every fieldnode

methods.name: injectRaw
methods.description: Injecten eines raw models wie bspw body oder entity einer collection

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resete zum letzten injected state zurück

methods.name: getJson
methods.description: Returns a json representation of your Data Object

methods.name: _initFieldsFromSpec
methods.description: eslint-disable-next-line class-methods-use-this

classes.name: DataObject

classes.description:
`UniversalFieldNodeBinder` consumes a FieldNode of any type, google wrapper or FAT and exposes
a API for data binding purposes.

Google wrapper types are handled like skalar values

## specifity
**meta < fat annotations**
**attributes on element > fat annotations > meta**

Spec meta and dynamic meta is handled in DataObject and FieldNode.

If meta was given and the same property is not set in the fat type anymore, the value will fall back to the given value from the meta.

properties.name: targetValueField
properties.description:
Define the property for the value on the component. If the value in the fieldnode changes
this property will be updated

properties.name: labelMappings
attributeMappings
properties.description:
Define the mappings for the attributes which will be set on the component if it is set in the fieldnode.

```
 // set the attribute mappings
 this.binder.attributeMappings = {
   'label': 'placeholder', // map label to placeholder
   'placeholder': 'placeholder', // map placeholder to placeholder
   'hint': '_hint',
   'icon': 'leadingIcon', // icon and leading icon maps to the same
   'leading-icon': 'leadingIcon',// icon and leading icon maps to the same
   'value-state': '_valueState',
   'value-state-message': '_valueStateMessage',
   'errortext': '_errorMsg', // name errortext is for compatibility with spec
   'warning-msg': '_warningMsg',
   'success-msg': '_successMsg',
   'information-msg': '_informationMsg',
   'pattern': 'pattern',
   'maxlength': 'maxlength', // for the input element itself
 };
```

properties.name: fatAttributesToConstraintsMappings
properties.description:
Define the attributes which maps to the field constraints.

```
this.fatAttributesToConstraintsMappings = {
  'max': 'value._constraints.max.is',// for the fieldnode max constraint
  'min': 'value._constraints.min.is',// for the fieldnode min constraint
  'min-msg': 'value._constraints.min.message',// for the fieldnode min constraint message
  'max-msg': 'value._constraints.max.message',// for the fieldnode max constraint message
}
```

properties.name: fieldValue
properties.description: returns the current value of the field

methods.name: bindField
methods.description: binds the fieldNode and read the metas

methods.name: addLabel
methods.description: adds a label to the fat fieldNode. Adding labels to scalar or complex works too, but will never updated on the fieldNode.

methods.name: deleteLabel
methods.description: deletes a label from a fat fieldNode

methods.name: setAttribute
methods.description:
Sets the value of a named attribute of the current node. Like value-state="Error".
Do not forget to add the mappings with `xxx.attributeMappings = { 'value-state': 'valueState' };` to reflect the value to your component.

methods.name: removeAttribute
methods.description: removes a named attribute from the fieldNode.

methods.name: _updateVirtualNode
methods.description: Sets the correct value for the given fieldnode to the virtual node and this.fieldValue according to the signature of the field

methods.name: _addVirtualAttribute
methods.description: Adds or updates a attribute to the virtual node and set the attribute on the target component if mapping is defined

methods.name: _pathSet
methods.description: helper to set deep paths

methods.name: _removeVirtualAttribute
methods.description:
Removes a attribute from the virtual node and sets the attribute on the target component to null, so lit will remove it on reflected attributes.

 https://lit-element.polymer-project.org/guide/properties#attributes

methods.name: _addVirtualLabel
methods.description: Adds a label to the virtual node label set and sets the label on the target component to `true` if mapping is defined.

methods.name: _removeVirtualLabel
methods.description: Removes a label from the virtual node label set and sets the label on the target component to `false` if mapping is defined.

methods.name: checkLabelandAttributeOverrrides
methods.description:
check overrides from the used component, setted attributes overrides all internal settings.
All we have to do is removing the setted mappings for the current instance.

**Hint:** Do this after initializing the mappings.

methods.name: detectFormat
methods.description: detects the kind of the fieldNode (scalar, fat)

methods.name: _updateVirtualNodeFromMeta
methods.description: updates the virtual node attributes and labels with metas from the fieldnode

classes.name: UniversalFieldNodeBinder
